text: Brickellia conduplicata (southwestern brickellbush) is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to northeastern Mexico in the states of Tamaulipas and San Luis Potosí.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272Turner, Billie Lee 1990. Phytologia 68:162 distribution map, as Brickellia lemmonii var. conduplicata ==References== ==External links== *Photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, collected in San Luis Potosí, syntype of Brickellia conduplicata conduplicata Category:Flora of Northeastern Mexico Category:Plants described in 1907
title: Brickellia conduplicata
